text: Jere Koponen (born 23 May 1992 in Turku) is a Finnish football goalkeeper for Turun Palloseura. ==Career== Koponen started his career at FC Inter Turku and won the Finnish U19 championship with his club in 2011. In April 2012, he joined KTP on loan until August, but he returned to FC Inter already in June after having made 9 appearances for KTP. In December 2012, he extended his contract with FC Inter until end of 2014. For the 2015 season he joined SJK on a one-year contract and won the Finnish championship as second goalkeeper behind Mihkel Aksalu with one appearance during the season. Koponen left Inter Turku for the second time, at the end of the 2018 season.Veikkausliigan siirrot talvella 2018-2019, veikkausliiga.com, 23 December 2018 From spring 2019 he is a member of lithuanian FK Palanga.Profile at A Lyga, alyga.lt In summer 2019 he left FK Palanga. In August 2019, he then returned to his former club, TPS.MAALIVAHTI JERE KOPONEN VAHVISTAA TPS:ÄÄ LOPPUKAUDEN, fc.tps.fi, 11 August 2019 ==References== ==External links== * * Jere Koponen profile at Veikkausliiga Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Finnish footballers Category:Finnish expatriate footballers Category:FC Inter Turku players Category:Seinäjoen Jalkapallokerho players Category:Veikkausliiga players Category:Kotkan Työväen Palloilijat players Category:Turun Palloseura footballers Category:FK Palanga players Category:A Lyga players Category:Kakkonen players Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Finnish expatriate sportspeople in Lithuania Category:Expatriate footballers in Lithuania
title: Jere Koponen
